page.title: 06Mixed Farming in Cumbria
page.content:
The l5 farms in this block all have Friesian dairy herds and beef cattle, mainly Charolais and Limousins, and half of them have sheep. A few breed sheep or buy and resell fat lambs, but most just provide winter grazing. Breeds include Cheviots, Grey faced and Suffolks. One farmer keeps a few pigs. Some wives keep hens or fatten turkeys for Christmas.
About 10 of the farms grow between 5 and 30 acres of barley. All the farms make hay and/or silage for winter feed; perhaps half the total acreage is used for silage.Large farms have silage pits, smaller ones make bales which are bagged in black polythene. 3 farms grow turnips and some are trying out Tyfon, a new turnip/cabbage used as a catch crop with rye.
